We proposed HyCOR, an hybrid approach that combines the expressiveness of SPARQL and the efficiency of a dedicated algorithm.

Our contribution is threefold: (i) we show how chronicles can be encoded as SPARQL queries to enumerate all their occurrences in a sequence of events represented in RDF; (ii) we propose HyCOR, an hybrid method combining the expressiveness of Semantic Web and the efficiency of a pattern occurrence enumeration algorithm; (iii) we evaluate HyCOR on a real case study of enumerating VTE events in the French MADB.
Furthermore, it could be interesting to compare the efficiency of different SPARQL engines.

The keystones of Semantic Web are (i) formal data representations, such as the RDF language, and (ii) the query language SPARQL.
We propose two approaches for chronicle enumeration: the first approach fully uses Semantic Web technologies; the second approach is an hybrid tool combining SPARQL query and a dedicated algorithm.

Our contribution is threefold: (i) we show how chronicles can be encoded as SPARQL queries to enumerate all their occurrences in a sequence of events represented in RDF; (ii) we propose HyCOR, an hybrid method combining the expressiveness of Semantic Web and the efficiency of a pattern occurrence enumeration algorithm; (iii) we evaluate HyCOR on a real case study of enumerating VTE events in the French MADB.

Our contribution is threefold: (i) we show how chronicles can be encoded as SPARQL queries to enumerate all their occurrences in a sequence of events represented in RDF; (ii) we propose HyCOR, an hybrid method combining the expressiveness of Semantic Web and the efficiency of a pattern occurrence enumeration algorithm; (iii) we evaluate HyCOR on a real case study of enumerating VTE events in the French MADB.
